title: Push data from the source UCMDB customer to the target UCMDB customer
content:
This topic describes how to migrate CIs from the source UCMDB customer to the target UCMDB customer for Native SACM.

Prerequisite 

  • Make sure that the existing UD/UCMDB tenants in the source UCMDB customer are also created as preparation in the target UCMDB customer.
  • There are no CIs existing in the target UCMDB customer. 
  • To guarantee CIs' global IDs remain unchanged after CIs are pushed from the UCMDB source customer to the target customer, you can use the UCMDB JMX console command for both customers, as shown below, and make sure that "All" is returned in each response.

Migrate customizations

Follow the instructions in this section to migrate customizations.

Assumption

  • You haven't enabled multi-tenant on the source UCMDB. Migrating customizations is only supported on the tenantless mode of UCMDB.
  • All actions performed in the source UCMDB  require administrator privileges of UCMDB.

Scenario A - When you have a limited amount of customized resources

Persona Location

Customer admin
  • Source UCMDB
  • Target UCMDB

As a customer admin, if you have a limited amount of customized resources, or you know clearly which changes you've made, do the following to migrate customization data.

  1. Export customization data from the source UCMDB.

    1. Create a new package that contains the customization data.
      1. Log in to UCMDB Local Client of the source UCMDB.
      2. Go to Administration > Package Manager, and click the Create custom package  button. The Create Custom Package Wizard opens.
      3. On the Package Properties page, provide a unique package name, for example, <Customer_Name>_All_Queries. Click Next.
      4. On the Resource Selection page, select all customized resources. Click Next.
      5. On the Selection Summary page, review the customized resources, and click Finish. The new package is saved.
    2. In the Package Manager main window, select the package you just created, and click the Export package to local directory button to export the package to your local folder.

  2. Deploy the package from UCMDB UI of the target UCMDB. For details, see Deploy a Package from UCMDB UI.

Scenario B - When you have lots of customized resources

Persona Location

Customer admin
  • Source UCMDB
  • Target UCMDB

As a customer admin, if you have lots of customized resources, do the following to migrate customization data. 

Task 1. Upgrade UD Content Pack (CP)

On the target UCMDB side, make sure that you upgrade the UD Content Pack to meet the version requirements as indicated in the tenant admin tasks after the version update.

On the source UCMDB, to migrate without data loss, the CP version on the source UCMDB must match the CP version on the target UCMDB. If the CP on the source UCMDB isn't at the latest version, make sure that you upgrade it to match the CP version on the target UCMDB:

  1. Download the latest CP installation package that supports your UCMDB server from ITOM Marketplace. 

    Tip To check the CP version on the target UCMDB, access UCMDB UI, click Help   > About, and expand the Version section.

  2. On the source UCMDB, log in to the UCMDB Local Client, navigate to Administration > Infrastructure Settings Manager, and set the value of the following settings to True:

    • Merge Packages/Content Pack
    • Merge Discovery Scripts

  3. Back up the existing Content Pack and deploy the new Content Pack. For details, see Install Content Pack.

Task 2. Maintain all customizations for out-of-the-box (OOTB) resources

For details, see Maintain customizations for out-of-the-box resources.

Task 3. Create a new package for new resources 

For newly added resources, manually create a package to include the customizations. For detailed instructions, see Scenario A.  

Task 4. Export all packages, including OOTB resources and new resources

  1. Export all customization data from the source UCMDB.
    1. Log in to the JMX Console of the source UCMDB.
    2. Locate the exportPackages JMX method (in the UCMDB:service=Packaging Services category) to export all packages as a backup. (Leave package names empty for exporting all packages)  
    3. Provide values for the following parameters:
      • customerID: <Customer ID> (default: 1)
      • packagesNames: Leave this field empty to export all packages.
      • outputDir: Enter the full path to a directory where UCMDB should place the exported packages, for example, C:\temp\my_packages_backup. The directory is created automatically.
      • userOnly: Select False to export all packages (and not only the user-created packages).
    4. Click Invoke.
    5. Verify that all relevant packages have been backed up to the folder mentioned in the previous step.
  2. Deploy all the exported packages in the target UCMDB.  

Migrate Native SACM federated CIs

Persona Location
Customer admin Source UCMDB

Assumptions

The following is a list of assumptions and things that you must know before the CI migration:

  • You haven't enabled multi-tenant on the source UCMDB. Migrating CIs is only supported on the tenantless mode of the source UCMDB.
  • 1 to 1 CI mapping is expected as this setup is only for one-directional data push from the source UCMDB to the target UCMDB. The globalid of each CI in the source UCMDB will be transferred to the target UCMDB without change. Don't use the "PushbackID" feature to avoid pollution of the globalid on source UCMDB.
  • The target UCMDB must be empty without CI data. Otherwise, there is a chance of globalid collision when copying globalid from the source environment.
  • Only one source UCMDB is expected. This is also because of the concern of globalid collision. If you need to migrate CI from multiple UCMDB servers,  you must guarantee the uniqueness of globalid. (Usually by pushing CI to an aggregator UCMDB with the IDGenerator feature on.)
  • The provided TQL in the migration push adapter is based on OOTB UD discovery and will only cover the OOTB content. If you've created your own CIT or any links between CIs, you must manually create your own TQL to cover your own data.
  • It's expected to have fewer CIs in the target UCMDB environment at the beginning. The source UCMDB will still be the main discovery source for a period of time. The first push will take a long time and require user interaction. Then, the delta push should synchronize all the new CIs discovered from the source UCMDB to the target UCMDB with the defined schedule. This process can take months to complete as you migrate your discovery from the source UCMDB to the target UCMDB.
  • When the target UCMDB becomes the main discovery source, you can consider dropping the source UCMDB.

Prepare the system before migration

You need to use the UCMDB to SaaS adapter for data migration. To make sure that you have the adapter in your source UCMDB, follow these steps:

  1. Upgrade your Content Pack to CP 2022.05 or a later version.
  2. Log in to UCMDB Local Client of the source UCMDB.
  3. Go to Administration > Package Manager, and then make sure that the CmdbToSaaSAdapter package is in your UCMDB system.

Optionally, if you don't want to upgrade the Content Pack in the source UCMDB to get the new adapter, you can deploy the CmdbToSaaSAdapter.zip package only by following these steps:

  1. Unzip the downloaded Content Pack (2022.05 or later) to get the CmdbToSaaSAdapter.zip package file from the packages folder (CP<version>_installation.zip > content > content packs > CP <version>.xxx.zip > packages).
  2. From the UCMDB Local Client of the source UCMDB, go to Administration > Package Manager.
  3. Click the button to open the Deploy Packages to Server dialog box.
  4. Click the button to open the Deploy Packages to Server (from local disk) dialog box.
  5. Select the CmdbToSaaSAdapter.zip package file and click Open. The package appears in the upper pane of the dialog box and its resources appear in the lower pane. All the resources are selected by default.
  6. Click Deploy.

Create an integration point

To create an integration point with the new adapter, follow these steps:

  1. Log in to your source UCMDB as an administrator.

  2. Navigate to Data Flow Management > Integration Studio. A list of existing integration points is displayed.

  3. Click New Integration Point . The New Integration Point dialog box opens.

  4. Complete the Integration Properties and Adapter Properties fields as described in the following table:

    Field
    (*Required)

    		 Description
    Integration Properties section
    *Integration Name Type the name (unique key) of the integration point.
    Integration Description Type a description of the current integration point.

    Adapter

    Click the Select Adapter button and then select OpenText Products > UCMDB > UCMDB To SaaS.
    Is Integration Activated? Select this option to indicate the integration point is active.
    Adapter Properties section
    *Hostname/IP The target UCMDB hostname or IP.
    *Port The listening port for the target UCMDB.
    Protocol Select the connection proxy. For example, HTTPS (SSL).
    *Customer Name Enter the target customer name.
    *Credentials ID

    Credentials for the user of the target UCMDB customer.

    Click the Select Credential Id button, and then select Generic Protocol in the Protocol pane.

    Click   to create a new credential.

    To configure the credentials for this integration point:

    1. Provide values for the following fields:

      • User Label: Type a label for the credential.

      • Username: The name of the user used for authentication.

      • Password: The password of the user used for authentication.

    2. Click OK twice.

    Note: If you need to use a proxy server, in the Choose Credential page, select UCMDB Protocol to create a credential with the proxy configuration.
    Push Back Ids for Population     Select Disabled.
    Push Back Ids for Push Select Disabled.
    *Data Flow Probe

    The name of the Data Flow Probe/Integration service used to execute the synchronization. Make sure that the Probe can access the Hostname without a problem.
    Additional Probes Select additional probes to use in order to increase redundancy.
    For example:
  5. Click Test connection  to make sure there is a valid connection.

  6. Click OK.

The integration point is created and its details are displayed. 

Navigate to the integration point created above, and you can see four OOTB integration jobs with predefined TQLs for different types of CIs:

  • 01 Node

  • 02 NodeElement

  • 03 Discovery

  • 04 Business

Run push job: 01 Node

Important When you run the push jobs, you must run the job in the following sequence:

  • 01 Node

  • 02 NodeElement

  • 03 Discovery

  • 04 Business

Otherwise, you might get a mismatch of data and a failed push. In addition, start the next job only when the previous job is complete.

The first job is to push all the CIs of the Node type by using the predefined cluster_resource_group and node_with_identification queries. This should be the first bunch of CIs to be migrated.

Before you run the job, do the following configurations (in Administration > Infrastructure Setting Manager) according to your requirements to make this job successful:

  1. Increase Data Push Job Timeout. Increase the value based on your network performance. In the lab test, pushing 20,000 nodes takes about 6 hours.

  2. Adjust Data Push Chunk Size as needed. 
  3. Adjust Maximum number of data push job failures allowed in a sequence. Out of the box, if there are more than 20,000 CIs failed during the push, the job will be stopped. You can adjust the setting to a higher number based on your CI volume.

After configurations, run the "01 Node" job:

  1. Navigate to Data Flow Management > Integration Studio. A list of existing integration points is displayed.

  2. Select the integration point that you created for the migration.

  3. Go to the Data Push tab, select the 01 Node job, and then click the Edit Integration Job  button to edit the job as needed.

    Note
    • AutoDeletion must be enabled because complete data synchronization is required.

    • You can decide if you want to turn on Enable live job. The live job will push changes to the target UCMDB almost in real-time, but it consumes much more resources of the source UCMDB. Therefore, if acceptable, it’s recommended to use a daily schedule for delta push.

  4. Click Full Synchronization  . 
  5. Click the Refresh  button to check the status of the job. When the job is completed, the job status becomes one of the following depending on the results:
    • Completed successfully
    • Failed

  6. Click the Statistics tab to view the results; If any errors occur, click the Query Status tab and Job Errors tab for more details.

  7. Check the failed nodes and manually resolve them.

    Note Don't continue until all node-related issues are solved as the node CIs are the most important data in UCMDB. Ignore the error only if you confirm the failed node is not useful and can be ignored. 

  8. Compare the number of Node CI in the source UCMDB and in the target UCDMB. Only when you confirm all nodes are migrated successfully, continue to the next step.

Run push job: 02 NodeElement

The second job is to push all the CIs of the NodeElement type. The process will take quite some time as this job migrates a large number of CIs.

Before you run the job, do the following configurations according to your requirements to make this job successful:

In TQL like node_with_installed_software, the "Query result exceeds zie limit" error might occur. To avoid the error, you need to increase the threshold by running the setting the tql.max.ci.layout.allowed parameter for a larger number (for example, 6000000):

  1. On UCMDB server, go to JMX Console > UCMDB:service=Settings Services > setSettingValue.
  2. Invoke the setSettingValue JMX method with the following parameters: name: node_with_installed_software value: 6000000.

After configurations, run the "02 NodeElement" job:

  1. Navigate to Data Flow Management > Integration Studio. A list of existing integration points is displayed.

  2. Select the integration point that you created for the migration.

  3. Go to the Data Push tab, select the 02 NodeElement job, and then click the Edit Integration Job  button to edit the job as needed.

    Note It's recommended that you don't select Enable live job because the node element involves a huge number of CIs. Instead, use a daily schedule to push delta.
  4. Click Full Synchronization  . For node element, you can run node element push in parallel jobs:
  5. Click the Refresh  button to check the status of the job. When the job is completed, the job status becomes one of the following depending on the results:
    • Completed successfully
    • Failed

  6. Click the Statistics tab to view the results; If any errors occur, click the Query Status tab and Job Errors tab for more details.

When the job is completed successfully, continue to the next step.

Run push job: 03 Discovery

The third job "03 Discovery" is to push the discovered CIs with the help of predefined queries.

  1. Navigate to Data Flow Management > Integration Studio. A list of existing integration points is displayed.

  2. Select the integration point that you created for the migration.

  3. Go to the Data Push tab, select the 03 Discovery job.

  4. Click Full Synchronization  . 
  5. Click the Refresh  button to check the status of the job. When the job is completed, the job status becomes one of the following depending on the results:
    • Completed successfully
    • Failed

  6. Click the Statistics tab to view the results; If any errors occur, click the Query Status tab and Job Errors tab for more details.

When the job is completed successfully, continue to the next step.

Run push job: 04 Business

The last job "04 Business" is to push the CIs of Business type with the help of predefined queries.

  1. Navigate to Data Flow Management > Integration Studio. A list of existing integration points is displayed.

  2. Select the integration point that you created for the migration.

  3. Go to the Data Push tab, and select the 04 Business job.

  4. Click Full Synchronization  . 
  5. Click the Refresh  button to check the status of the job. When the job is completed, the job status becomes one of the following depending on the results:
    • Completed successfully
    • Failed

  6. Click the Statistics tab to view the results; If any errors occur, click the Query Status tab and Job Errors tab for more details.

Migrate remaining CIs

With the help of seeded TQLs in the cmdbToSaaS adapter, the Native SACM federated CIs are pushed from the source UCMDB to the target UCMDB. 

For the full-mode migration, you need to create more TQLs manually based on the customer's data to migrate the remaining CIs to the target UCMDB. Make sure that you stop Universal Discovery for the source UCMDB before you do the last run of delta synchronization so that all the CIs are pushed to the target UCMDB. 

Note If you need help when creating TQLs for the customer, contact your support representitive.
